[File: types/src/transaction/signature_verified_transaction.rs] [Enum: SignatureVerifiedTransaction] [Enum discriminant manipulation] Can unsafe code or memory corruption change the enum discriminant from Invalid to Valid without re-verification, bypassing all security checks? (Critical)

[File: types/src/transaction/signature_verified_transaction.rs] [Enum: SignatureVerifiedTransaction] [Consensus vs. Execution disagreement] Can consensus mark a transaction as Valid while execution marks it Invalid (or vice versa) due to state differences, causing non-deterministic commits? [File: types/src/transaction/signature_verified_transaction.rs] [Enum: SignatureVerifiedTransaction] [Multi-signature transaction bypass] For multi-agent transactions, does verification check all signers, or can partially signed transactions be marked Valid if the primary sender's signature is correct?
